thread.title: Doctor fined for mistaken hysterectomy on pregnant woman
thread.title_full: Doctor fined for mistaken hysterectomy on pregnant woman | The Seattle Times

author: seattletimes.com
title: Doctor fined for mistaken hysterectomy on pregnant woman
text:
WATERBURY, Conn. (AP) — A Connecticut gynecologist has been fined $5,000 for mistakenly performing a hysterectomy on a patient he didn’t know was pregnant.
The state Medical Examining Board issued the fine against Dr. Jonathan Foster on Tuesday.
Foster performed a laparoscopic hysterectomy, a procedure that removes the uterus, on the woman at Saint Mary’s Hospital in Waterbury in January 2011.
A consent order Foster signed in July says he failed to detect the pregnancy before the operation.
Most Read Stories Chelan blazes: With no end in sight, thousands evacuate Reactions mixed to NYT story about Amazon’s work conditions South Snohomish softball team loses Little League World Series tiebreaker game, 3-2 Motel 6 in Bremerton explodes into flames South Snohomish softball team accused of throwing World Series game The order says he relied on the patient’s belief that she wasn’t pregnant. While he did perform a pregnancy test, the order says the result couldn’t be determined either way.
Foster didn’t contest the board’s findings and waived his right to a hearing, which means he accepted the terms to keep his license.
The Associated Press
